conclusion: Several identical small steel balls are released from a certain position on an inclined plane every 0.1 seconds without initial velocity.
A photograph is taken of the several small steel balls rolling on the inclined plane.
It is measured that AB = 15 cm and BC = 20 cm.
The photograph has a 1:1 scale relationship with the actual object.
There are several small steel balls rolling on top of ball A.
Balls are released at regular intervals of 0.1 seconds, and they roll down the inclined plane under the force of gravity.
Since they start from rest, their positions at any given time will depend on the time since release and the acceleration due to gravity component along the incline.
When an object starts from rest and accelerates uniformly, the distance it travels is given by the equation: s = 1/2 a t^2.
Balls are released at regular intervals of 0.1 seconds, so the time differences between consecutive balls should be 0.1 seconds apart.
Assume that ball A was released first, then B, then C, and so on.
Let t be the time since the release of ball A.
The time since the release of ball B is t - 0.1 seconds, and for ball C, it's t - 0.2 seconds, and so on.
The positions of the balls can be expressed as: Position of A: s_a = 1/2 a t^2, Position of B: s_b = 1/2 a (t - 0.1)^2, Position of C: s_c = 1/2 a (t - 0.2)^2.
Given that AB = 15 cm and BC = 20 cm, we can write: s_a - s_b = 15 cm, s_b - s_c = 20 cm.
